## Private Member Typedefs

### LiveRegsDVInfo {#a29f50c014d318f7bd5391a8811537340}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>using llvm::ExecutionDomainFix::LiveRegsDVInfo =  std::vector&lt;DomainValue &#42;&gt;</>}>
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> currently in each register, or NULL when no value is being tracked.

This counts as a <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/domainvalue">DomainValue</a> reference.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/executiondomainfix-h/#l00128">128</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/executiondomainfix-h">ExecutionDomainFix.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### OutRegsInfoMap {#aa2e6cc750e2f33af7e57b6be3486fea1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>using llvm::ExecutionDomainFix::OutRegsInfoMap =  SmallVector&lt;LiveRegsDVInfo, 4&gt;</>}>
Keeps domain information for all registers.

Note that this is different from the usual definition notion of liveness. The CPU doesn&#39;t care whether or not we consider a register killed.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/executiondomainfix-h/#l00133">133</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/executiondomainfix-h">ExecutionDomainFix.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

### getAnalysisUsage() {#a101879a381eb818b929145a3354575b8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::ExecutionDomainFix::getAnalysisUsage (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/analysisusage">AnalysisUsage</a> &amp;) const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
getAnalysisUsage - This function should be overriden by passes that need analysis information to do their job.

If a pass specifies that it uses a particular analysis result to this function, it can then use the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pass/#a4863e5e463fb79955269fbf7fbf52b80">getAnalysis&lt;AnalysisType&gt;()</a> function, below.

### collapse() {#af1401bd55ffdf7647dff0b5d9cbc92ed}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void ExecutionDomainFix::collapse (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/domainvalue">DomainValue</a> &#42; dv, unsigned domain)</>}>
Collapse open <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/domainvalue">DomainValue</a> into given domain.

If there are multiple registers using dv, they each get a unique collapsed <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/domainvalue">DomainValue</a>.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/executiondomainfix-h/#l00190">190</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/executiondomainfix-h">ExecutionDomainFix.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/executiondomainfix-cpp/#l00112">112</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/executiondomainfix-cpp">ExecutionDomainFix.cpp</a>.

### merge() {#a400099433f030ba48a87545288e89fc6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool ExecutionDomainFix::merge (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/domainvalue">DomainValue</a> &#42; A, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/domainvalue">DomainValue</a> &#42; B)</>}>
All instructions and registers in B are moved to A, and B is released.
